name: Marc Andreessen
title: Co-Founder & General Partner
thesis: Backs bold founders building category-defining software companies. Believes software is eating the world and invests across enterprise, consumer, crypto, and bio with deep operational support.

name: Alfred Lin
title: Partner
thesis: Invests in companies with strong network effects and exceptional founders who can build enduring businesses. Focused on enterprise software, fintech, and consumer marketplaces.

name: Bill Gurley
title: General Partner (Emeritus)
thesis: Focuses on marketplace businesses and companies with strong unit economics. Believes in equal partnership models and concentrated portfolios with deep founder engagement.

name: Peter Fenton
title: General Partner
thesis: Invests in open source and developer-centric platforms that become critical infrastructure. Seeks founders with deep technical insight and authentic product vision.

name: Mary Meeker
title: Founder & General Partner
thesis: Backs growth-stage technology companies leveraging major internet and mobile trends. Known for deep data-driven analysis of macro technology shifts.

name: Roelof Botha
title: Managing Partner
thesis: Seeks founders solving fundamental problems with elegant products. Particular focus on fintech, security, and consumer applications with viral growth mechanics.

name: Reid Hoffman
title: Partner
thesis: Invests in network-effect businesses and platforms that connect people at scale. Strong interest in AI/ML and enterprise collaboration tools. Also active as an angel investor.

name: Vinod Khosla
title: Founder
thesis: Invests in transformative technologies including clean energy, AI, and healthcare. Willing to take big technical risks on moonshot ideas that can impact billions of people.

name: Kirsten Green
title: Founder & Managing Partner
thesis: Focuses on commerce-driven companies reimagining how consumers discover, buy, and engage with products. Deep expertise in D2C brands and consumer behavior shifts.

name: Josh Kushner
title: Founder & Managing Partner
thesis: Invests across consumer internet, software, and healthcare companies at all stages. Known for early conviction in transformative platforms and long-term holding periods.

name: Matt Turck
title: Managing Director
thesis: Invests in early-stage enterprise and data infrastructure companies in NYC and beyond. Known for the annual Data & AI Landscape report. Deep expertise in data, AI, and developer tools.

name: Sarah Guo
title: Founder & Managing Partner
thesis: AI-native venture fund focused on companies building with and for artificial intelligence. Backs founders leveraging foundation models to rebuild entire industries.

name: Elad Gil
title: Angel Investor & Author
thesis: Prolific angel and seed investor in developer tools, AI/ML, and infrastructure companies. Author of 'High Growth Handbook'. Invests early in technical founders with deep domain expertise.

name: Naval Ravikant
title: Angel Investor & Founder
thesis: Invests in platform companies and network-effect businesses. Pioneer of syndicated angel investing through AngelList. Focuses on teams with authentic product insight.

name: Jeff Clavier
title: Founder & Managing Partner
thesis: Seed-stage specialist backing technical founders building enterprise and consumer software. One of Silicon Valley's earliest super-angels turned institutional seed fund.

name: Jenny Lee
title: Managing Partner
thesis: Invests in cross-border technology companies connecting US and Asian markets. Focus on enterprise SaaS, marketplace platforms, and social commerce at global scale.

name: Lee Fixel
title: Founder
thesis: Growth-stage investor seeking exceptional companies with proven product-market fit. Former Tiger Global leader with focus on consumer internet and enterprise software globally.

name: Chris Dixon
title: General Partner, a16z crypto
thesis: Leads a16z's crypto fund, investing in blockchain infrastructure, DeFi, and Web3 applications. Believes decentralized networks are the next major computing paradigm.

name: Ann Miura-Ko
title: Co-Founding Partner
thesis: Seed-stage investor focused on finding 'thunder lizard' startups—companies that create entirely new categories. Deep expertise in marketplace dynamics and technical infrastructure.

name: Mike Maples Jr.
title: Co-Founding Partner
thesis: Pattern-breaks investor seeking radical startups that inflect the future. Coined the term 'micro VC' and focuses on backing founders with proprietary insights at the earliest stages.

name: Josh Wolfe
title: Co-Founder & Managing Partner
thesis: Invests in frontier technology companies commercializing science. Focus areas include advanced materials, synthetic biology, space, robotics, and defense tech. Seeks 'sci-fi becoming real.'

name: Brian Singerman
title: Partner
thesis: Backs transformative companies tackling hard technical problems. Focus on biotech, AI, and aerospace. Willing to bet on ambitious, contrarian founders with deep expertise.

name: Keith Rabois
title: General Partner
thesis: Operator-investor focused on marketplace companies, fintech, and real estate tech. Former PayPal Mafia member who backs founders with strong operational clarity and urgency.

name: Satya Patel
title: Co-Founder & Partner
thesis: Seed-stage focus on 'Bottom Up Economy' companies—startups empowering individuals and small teams to do more. Deep expertise in product management and go-to-market.

name: Hunter Walk
title: Co-Founder & Partner
thesis: Backs seed-stage companies building tools for the 'Bottom Up Economy.' Former YouTube head of product. Focuses on product-led growth and community-driven businesses.

name: Mamoon Hamid
title: Partner
thesis: Invests in enterprise SaaS companies with bottoms-up adoption and strong product-led growth. Previously at Social Capital. Seeks founders who deeply understand their users.

name: Ilya Fushman
title: Partner
thesis: Focuses on enterprise infrastructure, security, and developer tools. Former Dropbox VP. Invests in technical founders building core infrastructure for the modern enterprise.

name: Jason Calacanis
title: Angel Investor & Founder
thesis: Prolific angel investor focused on early-stage startups across sectors. Host of 'This Week in Startups.' Invests in scrappy founders with strong hustle and product instincts.

name: Garry Tan
title: President & CEO
thesis: Leads the world's most prolific startup accelerator backing 400+ companies per year. Focus on technical founders at the earliest stage across all sectors. Also active personal angel investor.

name: Dalton Caldwell
title: Managing Director, Head of Admissions
thesis: Evaluates and selects the most promising startups for YC. Focuses on team quality, market size, and founder-market fit. Deep expertise in social/consumer and enterprise SaaS.

name: Brad Feld
title: Co-Founder & Partner
thesis: Pioneer of thesis-driven early-stage investing focused on internet infrastructure, dev tools, and SaaS. Strong advocate for startup communities outside Silicon Valley. Author of 'Venture Deals.'

name: Fred Wilson
title: Co-Founder & Partner
thesis: Thesis-driven investor focused on large networks of engaged users, open protocols, and decentralized systems. Pioneer blogger in VC. Backs platforms that broaden access to resources.

name: Albert Wenger
title: Managing Partner
thesis: Focuses on companies enabling the 'knowledge age' through open data, decentralized systems, and broadened access. Author of 'World After Capital.' Invests in mission-driven founders.

name: Semil Shah
title: Founder & General Partner
thesis: Pre-seed and seed investor in technical founders building enterprise and fintech companies. Invests with conviction early and maintains strong founder relationships throughout the journey.

name: Charles Hudson
title: Founder & Managing Partner
thesis: Pre-seed investor focused on underrepresented founders and overlooked markets. Backs product-focused founders with unique insights at the earliest stages before most VCs engage.

name: Pejman Nozad
title: Co-Founder & Managing Partner
thesis: Pre-seed and seed specialist focused on Stanford and Bay Area technical founders. Known for discovering talent early. Invests in AI, enterprise, and deep tech at inception.

name: Aileen Lee
title: Founder & Managing Partner
thesis: Seed-stage investor who coined the term 'unicorn.' Focuses on large consumer and enterprise markets with network effects and data moats. Values diverse founding teams.

name: Cyan Banister
title: Angel Investor
thesis: Prolific angel investor with focus on frontier tech, space, and unconventional founders. Backs visionaries working on hard problems that most investors shy away from.

name: Alexis Ohanian
title: Founder & General Partner
thesis: Backs founders building at the intersection of technology, community, and culture. Focus on crypto, gaming, and consumer social. Believes in the creator economy and internet-native brands.

name: Li Jin
title: Founder & General Partner
thesis: Invests in the passion economy and creator tools. Backs platforms that enable individuals to monetize their unique skills and creativity. Pioneer of the 'creator economy' thesis.

name: Sahil Lavingia
title: Angel Investor & CEO of Gumroad
thesis: Invests in bootstrapper-friendly, creator-focused startups. Believes in sustainable business models over growth-at-all-costs. Backs founders building tools for independent creators.

name: Balaji Srinivasan
title: Angel Investor & Author
thesis: Invests in crypto, network states, and decentralized technology. Former CTO of Coinbase and a16z GP. Backs founders building sovereign technology and decentralized infrastructure.

name: Lachy Groom
title: Angel Investor
thesis: Former Stripe leader turned prolific angel. Invests in fintech infrastructure, developer tools, and AI companies. Known for large angel checks and deep fintech expertise.

name: Scott Belsky
title: Angel Investor & Adobe CPO
thesis: Invests in design-forward, product-led companies at the intersection of creativity and technology. Founder of Behance. Focus on tools empowering creative professionals.

name: David Sacks
title: Co-Founder & General Partner
thesis: Invests in SaaS and marketplace companies with strong network effects and data moats. Former PayPal COO and Yammer CEO. Focuses on capital-efficient businesses with clear paths to profitability.

name: Chamath Palihapitiya
title: Founder & CEO
thesis: Invests in healthcare, climate, and enterprise companies solving fundamental societal problems. Pioneered 'Capital as a Service' model. Also active in SPACs and public market investing.

name: Arlan Hamilton
title: Founder & Managing Partner
thesis: Exclusively invests in underrepresented founders—women, people of color, and LGBTQ+ entrepreneurs. Believes the best returns come from backing overlooked talent and underestimated markets.

name: Brian Armstrong
title: Angel Investor & CEO of Coinbase
thesis: Invests in crypto/Web3 infrastructure, DeFi protocols, and companies building the open financial system. Also backs AI and biotech founders with ambitious visions.

name: Nat Friedman
title: Angel Investor & Former GitHub CEO
thesis: Invests in AI-first companies and open source infrastructure. Former GitHub CEO with deep expertise in developer ecosystems. Backs ambitious founders building transformative AI applications.

name: Daniel Gross
title: Angel Investor & Founder
thesis: Invests in AI infrastructure and applied AI companies. Co-invested with Nat Friedman in many AI deals. Founded Pioneer to find and fund talent globally. Former head of AI at Apple.

name: Patrick Collison
title: Angel Investor & CEO of Stripe
thesis: Selectively invests in companies advancing science, progress, and technology infrastructure. Founded Stripe. Interested in longevity, AI, and tools for scientific advancement.

name: Trae Stephens
title: Partner
thesis: Invests in defense tech, government tech, and dual-use technology companies. Co-founded Anduril. Focuses on companies modernizing national security and critical infrastructure.

name: Andrew Chen
title: General Partner
thesis: Focuses on consumer and marketplace companies with viral growth loops. Expert in growth metrics, network effects, and product-led acquisition. Author of 'The Cold Start Problem.'

name: Martin Casado
title: General Partner
thesis: Invests in enterprise infrastructure, cloud, and security companies. Co-founder of Nicira (acquired by VMware for $1.26B). Deep technical expertise in networking and distributed systems.

name: Anjney Midha
title: General Partner, Games & AI
thesis: Leads AI investments at a16z, focusing on foundation model companies and AI-native applications. Believes AI will transform every industry and backs infrastructure plus application layer.

name: Tomasz Tunguz
title: Founder & Managing Partner
thesis: Data-driven investor focused on AI-first enterprise companies. Former Redpoint partner, known for deep SaaS benchmarking. Backs companies leveraging AI to create 10x better enterprise software.

name: Brad Gerstner
title: Founder & CEO
thesis: Crossover investor spanning public and private markets with focus on cloud, enterprise, and consumer internet. Known for large growth-stage bets in category-defining companies.

name: David George
title: General Partner, Growth
thesis: Leads growth-stage investments at a16z, focusing on scaling companies with proven product-market fit. Expertise in SaaS metrics, go-to-market, and building sales organizations.

name: Pat Grady
title: Partner
thesis: Invests in enterprise software companies with bottoms-up adoption models. Deep focus on AI-native enterprise tools and developer platforms. Expert in usage-based pricing and PLG.

name: Mike Volpi
title: Partner
thesis: Invests globally in enterprise and consumer technology companies. Particular expertise in open source, data infrastructure, and developer tools. Strong European network.

name: Danny Rimer
title: Partner
thesis: Backs consumer internet and marketplace companies globally. Early backer of transformative European startups. Focuses on network effects and global scalability.

name: Luciana Lixandru
title: Partner
thesis: Leads European investments for Sequoia. Focuses on enterprise software, marketplaces, and fintech companies with global ambitions. Deep knowledge of European startup ecosystem.

name: Neeraj Agrawal
title: General Partner
thesis: Enterprise SaaS specialist investing in category-leading B2B software companies. Known for deep understanding of SaaS metrics, churn, and expansion revenue models.

name: Byron Deeter
title: Partner
thesis: Pioneer of cloud computing investing. Created the Bessemer Cloud Index (BVP Nasdaq Emerging Cloud Index). Backs cloud-native enterprise companies at all stages.

name: Ethan Kurzweil
title: Partner
thesis: Invests in consumer internet and vertical SaaS companies. Focus on companies using data and AI to disrupt traditional industries like healthcare and financial services.

name: Ravi Gupta
title: Partner
thesis: Focuses on fintech and infrastructure companies. Former Instacart COO. Brings deep operating experience to investments in companies scaling rapidly in complex regulated markets.

name: Peter Thiel
title: Co-Founder & Partner
thesis: Contrarian investor seeking companies building monopolies through proprietary technology. Believes in definite optimism and backing founders with secrets about how the world works.

name: John Doerr
title: Chairman
thesis: Legendary investor focused on transformative technology companies. Author of 'Measure What Matters' on OKRs. Now focused on climate and sustainability investments.

name: Emily Weiss
title: Angel Investor & Glossier Founder
thesis: Invests in consumer brands, D2C companies, and community-driven businesses. As Glossier founder, brings deep expertise in building iconic consumer brands with strong communities.

name: Jess Lee
title: Partner
thesis: Focuses on consumer and design-forward technology companies. Former CEO of Polyvore. Deep expertise in social commerce, creator tools, and community platforms.

name: Tom Loverro
title: General Partner
thesis: Growth-stage investor backing category-leading companies scaling from $10M to $100M+ ARR. Focus on enterprise SaaS, fintech, and marketplace businesses with clear unit economics.

name: Paul Madera
title: Co-Founder & Managing Director
thesis: Late-stage investor in enterprise and consumer technology companies approaching IPO. Crossover fund investing in both private and public markets with deep quantitative analysis.

name: Samir Kaji
title: CEO & Founder
thesis: Builds infrastructure for emerging fund managers. Deep expertise in the GP/LP ecosystem. Previously invested in and tracked hundreds of emerging managers and their performance.

name: Nikhil Basu Trivedi
title: Co-Founder & Partner
thesis: Invests in consumer companies at seed and Series A. Previously at Shasta Ventures. Focus on marketplace, subscription, and community-driven consumer businesses.

name: Eric Bahn
title: Co-Founder & General Partner
thesis: Pre-seed investor backing hustling founders worldwide. Believes speed of execution is the best predictor of startup success. High-volume, low-check-size model investing in 50+ companies per year.

name: Elizabeth Yin
title: Co-Founder & General Partner
thesis: Pre-seed generalist investor focused on speed, hustle, and founder resourcefulness. Former YC partner. Backs scrappy founders who can do a lot with very little capital.

name: Jenny Fielding
title: Co-Founder & Managing Partner
thesis: Invests in pre-seed companies globally with a community-driven model. Former Techstars MD. Uses a network of 500+ scouts to source deals worldwide.

name: Sunil Dhaliwal
title: Founder & General Partner
thesis: Seed and Series A investor focused on enterprise infrastructure and developer tools. Deep technical background. Invests in founders building fundamental layers of the technology stack.

name: Logan Bartlett
title: Managing Director
thesis: Invests in enterprise software and infrastructure companies. Host of the Cartoon Avatars podcast. Focus on AI-enabled enterprise tools and developer platforms.

name: Masha Bucher
title: Founder & General Partner
thesis: Early-stage investor combining venture capital with media strategy. Helps portfolio companies get press coverage and build narratives. Focuses on consumer, SaaS, and health.

name: Kevin Hart
title: Founder
thesis: Invests in consumer brands, entertainment technology, and companies reaching diverse audiences. Leverages celebrity network and media platform for portfolio support.

name: Nasir Jones (Nas)
title: Founder & Managing Partner
thesis: Invests in technology and consumer companies as an early-stage angel turned institutional investor. Focus on fintech, healthcare, and companies serving underrepresented communities.

name: Ashton Kutcher
title: Co-Founder
thesis: Invests in consumer technology, marketplaces, and companies at the intersection of entertainment and technology. One of the most successful celebrity investors in Silicon Valley.

name: Jared Leto
title: Angel Investor
thesis: Active angel investor in consumer technology and social platforms. Early backer of several unicorns. Focuses on companies transforming how people communicate and create.

name: Marc Benioff
title: Investor & Salesforce CEO
thesis: Invests in enterprise cloud, AI, and purpose-driven companies through personal fund. As Salesforce founder, brings deep enterprise expertise and network to portfolio companies.

name: Jeff Bezos
title: Founder
thesis: Personal investment vehicle for the Amazon founder. Invests in transformative technology, space, media, and healthcare companies. Known for patient, long-term capital deployment.

name: Esther Dyson
title: Angel Investor & Author
thesis: Pioneer technology investor focused on health, space, and digital governance. One of the earliest angels in the internet era. Now focused on health equity and community well-being.

name: Jim Sorenson
title: Chairman
thesis: Family office investing in impact-driven companies across healthcare, education, and social enterprise. Focuses on measurable social outcomes alongside financial returns.
